name: The American Club

reviews.text: I took a three-day trip to Kohler last year with one of my friends, and I have to say it was one of the best vacation experiences I've ever had. We booked the Girlfriends Getaway Spa package, which gets you a room in the Carriage House (directly above the Spa) and a discount on spa services.
reviews.title: Perfect In Almost Every Respect
Love the American Club
reviews.text: When we arrived, we checked in directly in the Carriage House. A very gracious woman checked us in from a small library desk in the entry lounge - we were surprised, at 5:00 at night, to find about 15 men and women sitting around the lounge sampling the complementary hor d'ouvres and wine, especially since many of them were in their bathrobes and slippers! It was a little disconcerting, but it really was very relaxed.

For an additional fee, we had upgraded our standard double room to a Deluxe room - helpful if you go in the Winter and think you'll spend any time in your room. The decorating style is true Wisconsin - not the luxurious linens you might expect from other five-diamond resorts, but nothing to sniff at. The room had a couch, desk, and minibar, and an extra sink in the room (helpful if there are two of you getting ready at any one time).
reviews.title: Great place to have a wedding - tremendous!

reviews.text: Everything about our two night stay was outsanding. The service we received from the bellman to the concierge to the restaurant staff was top notch. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, and with first class furnishings down to the Kohler bathroom fixtures to the duvee bed coverings. The hallways in the hotel wings are wonderfully framed in dark mahogany. The dining was excellent as well, especially at the Immigrant Room. Our experience there was among the top all time, from the dark, stone cave-like hall leading to the restaurant, cheese flights at the snappy adjacent Wine Bar and the cozy exclusivity of the restaurant's separate dining rooms.
reviews.title: Old World Masculine Charm
Truly an experience
reviews.text: The town of Kohler was really quiet and sleepy; not sure why. We were there on Labor Day weekend, and would have thought the place would be packed. Then again, we made our reservations 3-4 weeks in advance and received a discounted room rate, so, despite two weddings going on when we were there, perhaps they weren't full and perhaps the locals were out of town.

If you are looking at this resort for a wedding, I couldn't imagine much better of a place. We walked downstairs to see the banquet halls and everything looked very elegant. With myriad options for dining, golf, shopping, swimming (offsite) and working out (offsite), you wont get bored.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Love th American Club but
reviews.text: I have stayed there at least four times and all was wonderful! However, considering the close connection with the Kohler name and factory, I wonder why they do not have grab bars in their baths/showers. The fixtures are of excellent quality; but, getting in and out of the tub/shower is tough for short people or seniors like myself.
We visited the resort during a blizzard in January. The drive was tough but it was a winter wonderland when we go there. We are booking our next trip already. A real treat ....
reviews.title: Great Experience
Luxury with small town hospitality
reviews.text: My wife and I escaped city life for a couple days and stayed here in January. It turned out to be exactly what we needed. The staff is outstandingly friendly and helpful, they really made us feel welcome. What we really loved about Kohler is that it seemed like everyone - staff, guests, and residents alike - would at the very least extend a friendly hello. Lots of little things, like the turndown service, were a nice touch. One night after dinner we needed some ice, and upon grabbing the bucket with the intention of walking down the hall and filling it, I came to realize that it was already filled!

reviews.title: Great place to relax
reviews.text: The food was also excellent. We ate the first night at Cucina and just loved it. Strangely enough, we spent twice as much the next night at the Wisconsin Room and still liked Cucina better. Not that the food was bad, the service is what ruined it. Our waitress was extremely slow, I think she forgot about us half the time. We weren't in any hurry or else I would have complained, but we probably sat there for a half hour after we finished our entrees before another waitress finally came over and grabbed our plates. And they weren't even that busy! I thought that was nice of her to cover for our horrible waitress, but then she just threw the dessert menus in front of us without saying a word and stormed off. Then we had to wait another 15 minutes for our other waitress to come back just to tell her that we were too full for dessert. We just wanted to finally get the bill and get out of there, but upon looking at it I realized that they overcharged us on our entrees and one of our drinks. We eventually got it corrected, but the whole experience kind of put a damper on an otherwise perfect two days.

reviews.title: Not what you would expect
reviews.text: I would have given a perfect rating if it weren't for this, but maybe they were just having an off night. We are planning on going back again sometime because everything else was fantastic, we will just avoid the Wisconsin Room!

description: The American Club is a Forbes Five-Star Resort Hotel and the Midwest’s only AAA Five Diamond Resort Hotel providing unique, luxurious decor that with a singular quality experience room by room.
